page.title: 06ROADS IN STUBHAMPTON AREA
page.content: The unclassified road between Shaftesbury and Blandford (C13)runs North to South along the top of the escarpment near the western boundary of the area. It is thought to follow the original route and for much of its length it is straight and level, but not very wide. To the north however there is s steep descent down Spread- Eagle Hill into Melbury Abbas. The road is unsuitable for heavy vehicles but carries a good deal of lighter traffic, particularly in the holiday season, much of which travels at speeds excessive for the nature of the road. The Dorset Structure Plan includes proposals for upgrading this road to form the main route from Shaftesbury to Blandford, but no firm plans have yet been published, and this delay is causing considerable local anxiety.
